item.title: News24.com | The people must show leaders the door - Mbeki
item.description: Political leaders who have "overstayed their welcome"must be shown the door by their own people, former President Thabo Mbeki has said.

item.title: News24.com | Why Ben Ngubane quit
item.description: Interim leadership of Eskom was subject of high-stakes standoff between public enterprises minister and former chairperson.

item.title: News24.com | Jackson battles rogue MPs
item.description: ANC MPs who have asked for a broader state capture probe have stood their ground against their chief whip.

item.title: Fin24.com | Profit Trading founder arrested
item.description: A Pietermaritzburg businessman who founded alleged Ponzi scheme Profit Trading was arrested by the Special Commercial Crimes Unit on allegations of fraud at a Sandton Hotel.

item.title: Fin24.com | Legal firms ripping off state - Ngoepe
item.description: Most of the R1bn government has spent on legal services in the past year was never acted upon.

item.title: Channel24.co.za | Celebrities react to Bill Cosby mistrial
item.description: Celebrities have reacted strongly to the mistrial declared in Bill Cosby's trial on sexual assault charges.

item.title: Sport24.co.za | Action hots up in Rugby Challenge
item.description: The action is hotting up after a fascinating round eight of the SuperSport Rugby Challenge.

item.title: News24.com | Navy stops search for 7 missing sailors after bodies found
item.description: The commander of the US Navy's 7th Fleet says that search and rescue efforts are over for the seven sailors missing after a destroyer collided with a merchant ship in waters off Japan

item.title: News24.com | Three killed in blast at upscale Bogota mall
item.description: Three people have been killed and nine others have been wounded when an explosion rocked an upscale Bogota mall, authorities said, as the country's only active guerrilla group condemned the incident.

item.title: Channel24.co.za | Reports: Beyoncé and Jay Z  welcome twins
item.description: According to numerous reports Beyoncé and Jay Z have welcomed their twins.

item.title: News24.com | Excommunicating mobsters? Vatican eyes new legal doctrine
item.description: The Vatican wants to develop a new doctrine that calls for excommunicating Catholics for corruption and mafia association.

item.title: News24.com | Trump's Washington hotel saw almost $20m in revenue
item.description: President Donald Trump's financial disclosure shows his Florida resort is earning more money than it had previously.

item.title: News24.com | UPDATE: Huge Portugal forest fires kill 43, injure scores
item.description: Raging forest fires in central Portugal have killed at least 43 people, most of whom burnt to death in their cars, and injured scores of others, the government  has said.

item.title: News24.com | Tensions flare in Zambia as critics see slide to 'dictatorship'
item.description: Nearly a year after coming to power in a contested election, Zambian President Edgar Lungu is facing a growing chorus of criticism over his government's moves to clamp down on dissent.

item.title: Fin24.com | PPF vows to head to court to challenge FICA
item.description: The Progressive Professionals’ Forum has promised to challenge the recent signing of the Financial Intelligence Centre Amendment Act by Finance Minister Malusi Gigaba.

item.title: Sport24.co.za | WRAP: June Internationals
item.description: A comprehensive wrap of all of the weekend's June Internationals from around the rugby globe.

item.title: Fin24.com | Gigaba goes into overdrive
item.description: The latest credit downgrade and announcement of an official recession have triggered a long list of interventions to be spearheaded by Finance Minister Malusi Gigaba.

item.title: News24.com | Dlamini-Zuma: I’m ready to lead
item.description: ANC presidential candidate Nkosazana Dlamini-Zuma used an invitation by the ANC Youth League in Limpopo to finally accept nomination to be president.

item.title: News24.com | Mashatile endorses Ramaphosa
item.description: Deputy President Cyril Ramaphosa’s presidential bid got a boost yesterday when Gauteng ANC chair Paul Mashatile endorsed him as a leader who will instill confidence and protect the country from all forms of capture.

item.title: News24.com | ANC shuts door on stalwarts
item.description: The ANC intends to proceed with the planned consultative conference scheduled as part of the extended national policy conference later this month even without the party’s disgruntled stalwarts and veterans.
